headline: Double Rock Review
pros: Able to learn different types of financial banking products. Had to wear many different hats, so was able to gain exposure to various departments within the company.
cons: Extremely underpaid for work effort.  Corporate culture was not friendly, everyone for themselves, and senior management/sales setting unrealistic expectations.

headline: Wishing I hadn't taken the job.
pros: Close to mass transportation in arguably the least likeable area of the city.  Otherwise, no real "pros" to being employed here.
cons: No room for advancement and no formal review process.  There is an employee manual, but is adhered to in the loosest of terms, and at management's convenience.

headline: RUN ... In th opposite direction
pros: The only positive about working here is the company is soooo horrible that you have absolutely no qualms whatsoever about arriving precisely at 9 and leaving promptly at 5 - in this day and age, given the current economic climate - virtually unheard of!
cons: Nepotism, incompetence, antiquated systems, uncrupulous or non-existent business ethics ... I could go on, but you get the idea.
